intro: Dileptium precox, commonly known as the early thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are spiny and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Dileptium precox is known for its early blooming period, often appearing in late spring or early summer.
